sentences.sContent: ...compare those excellent letters with a merely good letter: the candidate was productive...
...The candidate was productive, or intelligent, or a solid scientist or something that's clearly solid praise, but nothing that singles out the candidate as exceptional to one of a kind...
...I would have automatically assumed the man was the best candidate because the position required quite a bit of extensive travel...
...she noticed that the candidate never made direct eye contact...

phrases.pCn: 合格的候选人；合资格人员

remMethod.val: can(能) ＋ did(做) ＋ ate → 能做实事的人才能当候选人 → 候选人

words.tran: [法] 候选人资格；候选人的地位（等于candidacy）

trans.tranCn: 申请求职者；投考者；候选人
trans.tranOther: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election
